No,I. conditions on which candidates from Indian otates are admitted to the folice Training School. (a) The candidate must be of good character and antecedents and free from undesirable political tendencies, regarding which a suitable guarantee will be required. (b) The candidate will be admitted if there is room for him at course and at the rate of Rs. 127 p.m. for the Dy • Superintendent s course will be charged for each candidate during the whole period the candidate is at ochool$ these fees are recoverable in advance for a period of three months at a time. (d) The candidate must pass a medical test before a commissioned Medical Officer of Government; he must also be vaccinatec, or if he has already been vaccinated, he must be re-vaccinated oefore .joining the School. (e) The candidate must submit to all rules of the School, disciplinary or otherwise. (f) The candidate should be paid by the State a suitable allowance while at the School., (g) The candidate is liable to removal if any of these condi- “tions are not fulfilled or in accordance with the regulations in force at the School. (h) The candidate must have passed the Matriculation of an Indian University or an equivalent recognised standard of education. If not, he must be sufficiently educated to follow lectures in English. (i) The candidate must ordinarily be not less than 5'-5' in height with a chest measurement of not less than 33 inches (deflated). (j) The candidate will be admitted to the School with the sanction of Government if, on personal interview, the Inspector General of Police finds him suitable. Expense on journey for the purpose of interview will not be reimbursed whatever the result. (k) All proposals in this respect must come through the the School. (c) Fees at the rate of Rs,96 p.m, for the Sub-Inspector’s Resident. BD3GOVERNMENT OF BAHRAIN. Confidential. D.O. No. 441/16 Bahrain, ixpril 15, 1939. physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 67; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 4-61; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Agent in Bahrain, Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave), Inspector General of Police in Poona, Superintendent of Police in Karachi and Tatta Districts, Government of Bombay (Home Department), Political Residency in the Persian Gulf at Bushire, and Air Headquarters in Iraq and Persia.The papers concern the recruitment and training of men for the Bahrain State Police, mostly arrangements for superintendent training for selected men at an officer training school in Nasik [Nashik] and for traffic control training in Karachi.Folios 62-66 are internal office notes.
